cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of aggregating individual rankings, which is a central topic in computational social choice (cs.GT). The paper proposes a family of geometric scoring rules, which involves mathematical analysis and optimization, making it relevant to computer science theory (cs.DS). The paper also discusses the application of these rules in sports and politics, which can be seen as a form of decision-making under uncertainty and can be studied using artificial intelligence techniques (cs.AI). The paper also involves statistical analysis and modeling, which can be seen as a form of machine learning (cs.SI). Finally, the paper discusses the design of scoring rules, which can be seen as a form of algorithm design and optimization (cs.LG).
